summary: Navy shipyards have been unable to keep up with maintenance demands for attack submarines. As a result, the Navy has spent $1.5 billion since 2008 to support submarines that it could not deploy. For example, the USS Boise has been docked for over 2 years while waiting for maintenance—with the Navy paying to support it. The Navy has begun to hire more workers at its...
title: Navy Readiness: Actions Needed to Address Costly Maintenance Delays Facing the Attack Submarine Fleet
